title: Ohms law - resistivity - current in bar from 2 V

content.question: A bar is connected to a <math alttext="2 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math> power supply, as shown in the figure. The bar is <math alttext="0.5 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> long, has a square cross section of side length <math alttext="0.10 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>, and is made from conductive material that has a resistivity of <math alttext="2 ohm meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>·</mo><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>. What is the current in the bar?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
